alert.note: Alert for Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:14PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Stewart County through 1100 PM CDT... At 1013 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eddyville to near Land Between The Lakes Area to 6 miles southeast of Murray. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Big Rock and Land Between The Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
